Title: EU LNG imports rise to all-time highs in November
Description: EU LNG imports hit an all-time high in November as the bloc strives to replace most of the lost Russian supplies with global LNG and keep its stocks as full as possible throughout this winter. The bloc’s import capacity will increase this month with the Dutch Eemshaven terminal set to be fully operational and the expected start of up to two terminals in Germany and one in Finland.
Author: DE

Title: Estonia’s Elering considers having its own LNG FSRU in Paldiski
Description: Estonia's Elering is considering connecting another LNG floating terminal to Paldiski instead of Finland’s Exemplar FSRU. Earlier this month, a company applied to connect their FSRU to Paldiski, but Elering is yet to receive the technical parameters of this FSRU to determine what work is needed to connect it to Paldiski.
Author: DE

Title: Ineos signs 20-year deal with Sempra for 1.4 mtpa of LNG from Port Arthur
Description: Britain-based petrochemicals firm Ineos has sealed a 20-year deal with Sempra Infrastructure to buy 1.4 mtpa from Port Arthur, alongside a non-binding agreement for more volumes. At least part of the supplies will go to Germany's planned Brunsbuttel LNG terminal.
Author: DE
